results.title: Next generation
results.brief_description: As the daughter of migrant parents Nella often felt “different and isolated from the other children at school”. Her strict father did not allow her to experience some of the advantages life in Australia had to offer so Nella was determined that her own daughter would have what she couldn’t. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Lands apart
results.brief_description: In this story Cathy tells the story of her parents who migrated to Australia and thanks them ” for your strength and the sacrifices you made to give us a better life” Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Journey home
results.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria
results.brief_description: Maria tells us the story of migration, hard work, loneliness and sacrifice that was her experience of leaving her native land to move to the other side of the world. There were many hard times, and she still misses Italy ‘but now I call Australia home’. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

group_siblings.title: Australia: per forza e per amore

results.title: It's never too late
results.brief_description: Maria claims that her first day in this country in 1959 was ‘magic’ but that in her new life everyone had to work hard and there was no time for lighthearted things. However in 1995 she experienced a change in life that taught her “It’s never too late”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

Journey home
group_siblings.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria

results.title: Growing up overnight
results.brief_description: Joe migrated in 1959 when he was 13 years old and became his family’s main wage earner less than a year later when his father lost a leg. In this story Joe gives us a glimpse of his experience since then saying his life is now “enjoying every day which is filled with friends and family”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

group_siblings.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
Journey home
group_siblings.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria

results.title: Emilio's story
results.brief_description: In 1952 Emilio left his family behind in Italy to come and earn money in Australia. He didn’t see them again until they came to join him 9 years later. Instead of a place to become rich and leave, Australia became his home. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
results.brief_description: Giovanni was working on an olive farm as a teenager when he was suddenly called home - he was leaving for Australia in 2 hours! In this story he tells of his life since that day and how he became a political figure in his new homeland. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Maniac de Luxe
results.material_description: two-channel video, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A dual screen video installation with thematic furnishing elements including low light household lamps, Maniac de Luxe interrogates the implications of private activities relocated into public space. Through a conceptual focus in the screen images on the interiors of large designer furnishing outlets and the cross cutting of footage on one screen between these public interiors and private dwellings which feature similar furnishings, the realm of private and public is increasing blurred and their boundaries rendered increasingly ambiguous. On a large rear projection screen, a group of characters sit and discuss private thoughts and issues in a designer furniture showroom, a further problematic to the division between private and public space. An ambient soundtrack along with two discrete soundscapes including dialogue from a group of characters and original music, will also inform the atmosphere of the installation, itself furnished as a room in a generic designer home.
